sections.title: Making Hindi Grammar Inclusive
sections.subtitle: a Non-Binary Voice in the Future (tense)

body.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Factoring in a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"non-binary voice","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" in the Future tense","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In Hindi when talking about future plans or actions that will be performed in the future, one laregly uses the future tense. These are equivalent to the English, “I will come”, “I will see”, “I will conquer”.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To see how the future tense works with the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"non-binary voice ","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"proposed by the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Making Hindi Grammar Inclusive","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" project, check out the links below.
